directions: Peel and chop the potatoes into small pieces.
Place the chopped potatoes in a large pot and cover with water.
Bring the water to a boil and cook the potatoes until they are very soft.
Drain the potatoes and let them cool.
In a separate container, dissolve the yeast in warm water and let it sit for 5 minutes.
Mash the cooked potatoes until they are smooth.
Combine the mashed potatoes and yeast mixture in a large container.
Cover the container with a lid or plastic wrap and let it ferment for 2-3 days.
After fermentation, strain the mixture through a cheesecloth or fine mesh strainer to remove any solids.
Transfer the liquid into a clean container and let it sit for another 3-4 days to allow any remaining solids to settle.
Carefully pour off the clear liquid, leaving behind any sediment at the bottom.
Gently filter the liquid through a coffee filter or activated carbon to remove any impurities.
Once filtered, pour the vodka into a clean bottle and seal.
Let the vodka rest for a week to allow the flavors to mellow.
After a week, your homemade vodka is ready to be enjoyed!
